sentences.en: A festive air filled the hall after the old man left.
sentences.cn: 老太爷进去以后,堂屋里显得更热闹了.

sentences.en: Beneath the festive mood there is an underlying apprehension.
sentences.cn: 在喜庆的背后存在着隐忧。

sentences.en: Christmas is often called the festive season.
sentences.cn: 圣诞节常被称做节日季节.

sentences.en: Despite the steady rain, the mood was friendly and festive.
sentences.cn: 尽管一直在下雨，气氛却相当友好欢快。

sentences.en: Festive paper decorations had been hung from the ceiling.
sentences.cn: 喜庆的彩纸已经挂在天花板上。

sentences.en: For many of us, the festive season can be one of the most stressful times of the year.
sentences.cn: 对我们很多人来说，圣诞期间可能是一年中压力最大的时候。

sentences.en: It was Christmas and everyone was in festive mood.
sentences.cn: 当时是圣诞节,每个人都沉浸在节日的欢乐中.

sentences.en: John was obviously in a festive mood .
She was looking almost festive in very shiny black satin.
sentences.cn: 她穿着发亮的黑色缎子衣服,看起来几乎象过节.

sentences.en: Start planning for Christmas now by stocking up the freezer with some festive dishes.
sentences.cn: 现在就开始为圣诞节做准备吧，首先在冰箱里备足过节的菜肴。

sentences.en: The 32-page catalog is chock-full of things that add fun to festive occasions.
sentences.cn: 32页的目录尽是些渲染节日喜庆的东西。

sentences.en: The atmosphere was festive and jolly.
The factory was due to shut for the festive period.
The meal gave the occasion an almost festive air.
sentences.cn: 这一餐使整个场合有了近乎节日般的喜庆氛围。

sentences.en: The town has a festive holiday atmosphere.
sentences.cn: 镇子上充盈着一种节日的喜庆气氛。

sentences.en: The whole town is in festive mood .
Untoward circumstances prevent me from being with you on this festive occasion.
sentences.cn: 有些不幸的事件使我不能在这欢庆的时刻和你在一起.

words.tran_cn: 节日；庆祝，纪念活动；欢乐

trans.tran_cn: 节日的，过节似的，喜庆的，欢乐的
trans.tran_en: looking or feeling bright and cheerful in a way that seems suitable for celebrating something
